title: Great meeting place for groups or as a starting point for your exploring!
text: The subway near our hotel let us off right in front of the New Rathaus/Glockenspiel area which made traveling back and forth to this area simple.  The Marienplatz puts you right in the middle of some of the most fabulous sites you will find in Munich.  You can easily walk to St. Peter's Church, walk through the Rathaus and wait for the Glockenspiel to chime.  There are lots of great shops down every street and you will also find the most amazing outdoor market where you will find anything from baked goods, flowers, delicatessen items, fruits and vegetables.  Make this this beginning point for your exploration of this great city.

title: Great Place to explore
text: This seems to be the central area in Munich with lots to see and do around this area. The main thing to see here is the Glockenspiel but there are plenty of museums and churches to look in.We came by just after Christmas so they were packing up the Christmas market that was here. Aside from the historical things to see here, there are plenty of food and shopping options. It is a must stop for someone who hasn't been here before to see some sights. There is also an information center close to the Glockenspiel entrance that we used here to get an idea of the surrounding area.

title: Assolutamente bella
text: Marienplatz √® il fulcro e lo snodo principale e pi√π importante della citt√†. Dalla sua fermata metro passano tutte le linee. ha una forma quasi rettangolare. La piazza √® dominata da un edificio in stile gotico che prende tutto un lato della piazza: √® il Neues Rathaus (Nuovo municipio), imponente e stilisticamente spettacolare. Sotto i portici si trova l'Ufficio turistico principale della citt√† dove parlano anche italiano. Tutta la piazza √® circondata da importanti edifici tra cui l‚ÄôAltes Rathaus (Vecchio municipio). Al centro domina la Mariensaule (Colonna della Vergine) con in testa la statua dorata della Madonna con il bambino in braccio. Rappresenta la patrona della Baviera. Alla base sono raffigurati quattro putti nell‚Äôatto di sconfiggere i mali come la peste, la guerra, l‚Äôeresia e la fame. Essendo il centro della citt√† dalla piazza ci si pu√≤ dirigere agevolmente in tutte le direzioni: per andare al Residenz, al Viktualmarket, alla Peterkirche, alla Frauenkirche, alla birreria Hofbrauhaus e in tanti altri posti.

title: Glockenspiel is a must!!!
text: Marienplatz offers shopping, caf√©s and a whole lot of history.The gem of this square though is by far the famous Glockenspiel.  This is not your typical clock, it is Its two levels of carved figurines that play out scenes from Munich's history to music.Make sure to see what times it will be playing before you make your plans.  The times vary between the seasons.You can go to Youtube for a preview :-)

title: People watching
text: Had lunch here in Marienplatz  while people watching and waiting for the glockenspiel to start up! Beautiful square in Munich with superb architecture. It was very busy when we were there late July/early Aug but still wonderful. The restaurants in the square are quite pricey. I ordered the Bavarian white sausage, it tasted...uniqueü§îü§≠

title: Cafes, street music, shopping- has it all!

title: Beautiful with history, architecture and ambience
text: To be fair, we had an image in our minds as to how Marienplatz would look, feel and sound. It's because of Gabriel Knight 2: The Beast Within (and yes, I realize how nerdy that makes me sound!)At any rate, all the images we'd had in our heads went right out the window the second we stepped out of the Bahnhof and saw the millions of Christmas Market stalls in our faces.NOT that I'm complaining! I was in Christmas Market heaven. We visited Marienplatz several times over the course of our five-day stay. It was crowded - except for early in the morning, which was my favorite time to visit. We did visit some of the "local" type stores on the Platz, but avoided the chains we know from home. It was easy to get lost and turned around with all the stalls and the side streets, but it was an amazing adventure. Marienplatz served as a kind of "home base" for us while we were in Munich. It was comfortable, had a good variety of restaurants and shops, and had a wonderful vibe. I loved the history and the architecture, and how central it all was.I would love to go back in another season, to visit the Platz without the market stalls (did I really say that?), and to see the area in sun and warmth. To, you know, see it as it was depicted in Gabriel Knight. Nerd alert!

title: Tourist, and local central
text: The area was awash with Christmas market stalls selling everything from mulled wine to various local festive delicacies - lots of little wooden shed everywhere which helped to create a very festive atmosphere despite being situated in the main shopping street, full of designer/brand-name shops.Despite being full of people on Christmas Eve we never felt and danger of being pickpocketed, unlike similar places in different cities, but caution is - as always - advised.Get off the main street and about a block behind the New Town Hall, and by the cathedral, there are some very good and reasonably priced restaurants which are full of locals. Always a good sign as often centrally located restaurants in tourist areas are bad and expensive. We had lunch in this are on both Christmas Eve and Christmas Day (when admittedly there wasn't much choice apart from fast food chains) and yet weren't disappointed at all.

title: The heart of Munich
text: Have visited Munich at Christmas time this year and of course one of the musts was Marienplatz with its wonderful Christmas market. We loved the stands, the decorations,the smells and tastes of the German gingerbread cookies, the hot wine called Gluewein and the roasted sweet almonds.. The square is surrounded by medieval buildings like the Rathaus and endless shopping opportunities and restaurants for everyone's taste and budget. I almost forgot! You must try the Bavarian Weisswurst! So yummy! In short, I am sure you will have a great time!

title: Bellissima
text: Bella piazza che merita una visita.√à poi alle 11.00 e alle 12.00 dopo il classico suono delle campane c √® il carillon a met√† torre con dei pupazzi che suonano e ballano una musica della Bavaria.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful location but we first visited on a Sunday and everything was closed. We also went to the square for New Year's Eve. We got there at 9pm and nothing was happening. All the shops were closed. No music or entertainment or activities for revellers. Reservations are a must for restaurants near the square on NYE, of course. Fireworks are no longer allowed to be set off in the square so if you are looking for that on New Year's Eve in Munich, pick another location in the city. All that being said, Marienplatz is a must see on your visit to Munich.

title: Great pedestrian only walk in Munich

title: Einfach sch√∂n
text: Man muss sich in die Mitte des Platzes stellen und dann ganz langsam drehen. Ein Blick ist sch√∂ner als der andere. Der Platz ist immer voll, trotzdem hat man nicht das Gef√ºhl erdr√ºckt zu werden. Wir "drehen" uns immer so, dass wir in die Seitenstra√üe zum Feinkostgesch√§ft Dallmayr kommen, essen da eine Kleinigkeit und der Tag ist perfekt.

title: Cuore pulsante
text: Marienplatz √® il cuore pulsante di Monaco di Baviera √® il centro della cittadina, in questa Piazza si affacciano il vecchio Municipio e il nuovo municipio. Quest'ultimo in stile neolitico, ha una torre con orologio e carillon che alle 11 e alle 12 d'inverno, mentre d'estate anche alle 21, si mette in movimento, le statuine mostrano la giostra dei Cavalieri durante la festa di matrimonio di Guglielmo V e i Bottai  festeggiano la salvezza dalla peste, alla fine il Gallo d'Oro muove le ali e canta 3 volte.Sotto la piazza si trovano la metro e i treni della s-bhan

title: Everyones "Must See" in Munich
text: Seemingly at the center of the old town in Munich, Marienplatz is rather the hub for commercial and sighting activity when visiting Munich. We were there shortly before Christmas so the Christ Kindal Markets were in full bloom. The Platz makes good starting point for self guided walking tours of the numerous great cultural attractions. As a special interest factor it is a prime point to get to the Uban public transit system.

title: Capodanno
text: Sui siti che parlano di questa piazza in genere non √® molto chiaro  cosa succeda in piazza a capodanno. Infatti molti, tra cui noi, credono che vi sia una specie di festa organizzata con tanto di fuochi d artificio. In realt√† NON √à COS√å. I Fuochi eventualmente sono sparati dai cittadini che lo desiderano, ma quest anno c'√® ne sono stati pochissimi e la piazza, dopo lo scoccare della mezzanotte, si √® liberata quasi subito. Nelle piazze adiacenti, invece, molta festa, molti fuochi!! Quindi consiglio di appostarsi direttamente altrove per un degno fine anno.Inoltre, il carillon della torre funziona alle 11 e alle 12, mentre alle 21 solo piccola ninna nanna deludente.

title: Heart of Historic Munich
text: For most of December, the square is transformed into a Christmas spectacle, notably with the expansive Christmas market, but also with many of the shops and sights along the square putting window displays, Christmas decorations, etc. We came here on two different occasions on this trip - one during the day on a Friday, and another on a Saturday night. It was pretty crowded both times, particularly on the Saturday, so plan accordingly if that is an issue for you. While it certainly had a heavy tourist feel to it, there was still an impressive variety of food and retail options in and around the Marienplatz.

title: Place which must not miss
text: If you at Munich then Marienplatz its 1 of the location which you must not miss. The surrounding building show the histories of Bavaria land. Most of the event in Munich will held at this place and you'll definitely be delighted by their environment. This area also surrounded by shop for you to shop around. The Glockenspiel play ( Clock show ) will start at 11am and 5pm daily ( winter got different time ). The Rathaus-Glockenspiel its the 4th largest Clock tower in Europe.

title: Marienplatz - the heart and soul of Munich
text: Obviously, you will want to research the times that the Glockenspiel  will put on its daily show.  You will find the times on the internet.  Don't be late, and bring your video camera.  This is a wonderful place to visit any time of the year, but especially so during the Christmas season.

title: Munich Old Town center
text: This is the kind of place I always want to see when I'm traveling in Europe. Old, traditional, well kept, clean, crowded and smelling culture and history.I just love the statue of Virgin Mary in the center of the square. Check the details about the clock show. The time varies a little depending on the season. The square gets very crowded and it gets hard to find a good place. It is also relatively long (more than 5 minutes you may get tired of holding a camera). A good tip is to see it from the Old Peter's Tower.

title: Very nice!

title: Very Gothic

Tourist Information Office is right next to the City Hall.  Easy to get to as there's a metro station right in the square.  The Christmas Market had just opened while I was there and I got to see the Christmas tree lighting ceremony too.  One of the most famous sights in Munich and well worth a visit.

text: I visited Marienplatz before but in another month.  Marienplatz in December was cluttered with shops in Christmas market. It was experiential to visit and have Gluwein and/or Kinder punch. Also, sausages were optonal to fancy restaurants.

title: Beautiful square but mostly overcrowded
text: Marienplatz is a beautiful sightseeing and certainly a must when you visit Munich, especially as it is also connected to the Viktualienmarkt, a permanent market with lots of regional and international food and non-food. However I may have been to Marienplatz 10 times in the last two years and it has always been completely overcrowded with tourists waiting for the famous The Glockenspiel or just blocking your way. So on one hand beautiful and on the other hand overcrowded mass tourism...

title: Great Christmas Market in December.
text: This is one of the largest Christmas Markets in Munich. Marienplatz is a lively place and offers many shopping opportunities besides the Christmas Market. It is crowded especially in the evening, so pack your patience and be prepared for a leisurely trek through the market.

The square has some beautiful buildings, and would be good to visit during the summer as well as winter.

title: Christmas fabulous

If you want to keep the novelty glasses (you pay for them as you buy your drink but this is refunded if you return the glass) be sure to keep them out of site as you leave or they may be taken from you to get the refund. Good family fun for the evening.

title: Bella Piazza
text: Una bella piazza al centro di Monaco, dove sorge il municipio, ma di cui non ho potuto godere a pieno il suo splendore inquanto piena delle caratteristiche casette di legno dedicate al mercatino di Natale

title: Christmas joy
text: You will see Marian Column, the beautiful clock tower with dancing figures, unique examples of  neo gothic architecture in New Rathaus and St. Peter's Church.  We experienced the joy of Christmas market with gorgeous Christmas tree and stalls selling ornaments, traditional food and mulled wine (Gl√ºhwein).

title: Very good sightseeing and Christmas markets
text: We recently visited Munich and found ourselves at Marienplatz on numerous occasions, enjoying the sightseeing opportunities in the area as well as the annual Munchner Christkindlmarkt (Christmas Market) being held here at this time of year. Marienplatz is where you find the beautiful Neo-Gothic Neues Rathaus, the earlier Altes Rathaus, St. Peter's Church as well as attractive fountains and monuments such as the MarienSaule (Marien Column). Most interesting and something well worth making plans to see is the 11am and 12pm chiming clock performances of Glockenspiel which is built into the clock tower of Neues Rathaus. During December, you can also enjoy the annual Christmas market here at Marienplatz. There is a giant Christmas tree setup in the middle of the square, which is filled with stalls selling traditional and season foods, mulled wine as well as Christmas ornaments, decorations and other items of interest. The holiday market provides a good way to spend another hour or so at and around Marienplatz while in addition to intended sightseeing endeavours you have in the area.

title: Feirinhas de Natal
text: O local √© muito legal para bater perna! As feirinhas de Natal s√£o encantadoras, com variadas op√ß√µes de comidas, bebidas e artesanatos tradicionais da Alemanha.

title: Hermosa plaza con su maravilloso ayuntamiento con su reloj.
text: Fuimos por la semana del 4 al 8 de diciembre y la preciosidad de la plaza mejoraba con su mercado de Navidad. Visita imprescindible en M√∫nich.

title: A sight to see
text: Marienplatz was fully of pretty christmas shops and good smells, and the Town Hall building was a sight to see. Very nice architecture and design; unfortunately I was not there to see the clock tower show.The area had a lot of people, but it wasn't too crowded.

title: Crowded but Festive
text: We enjoyed visiting Marienplatz and the Christmas Markets.  It was very busy (except on Sunday when the shops are closed) but the holiday vibe was in full swing.  Fun place to hang out with the locals.

title: Christmas markets galore
text: Between Karlsplatz and Marienplatz is the place to be if you like Christmas markets. There are a myriad of vendors who sell everything from Christmas souvenirs and gluhwein to bratwursts. Something for everyone and historic buildings to boot. This plaza is where you‚Äôll find St. Michaels church, the iconic double spired Frauenkirche, and town hall , Neues Rathaus. Photo ops galore day or night as these buildings are lit up.

title: Busy but beautiful place
text: Wonderful to walk around Marienplatz and enjoy the atmosphere during Christmas. Easy walk from tram stations.

title: Tremendous Christmas Tree and markets
text: The tree is spectacular set against the town hall building and at 5.30pm a brass band played from the balcony.  The main market was in the square itself, but there are a few splinter markets on the side streets too. As good as any I've seen before.

title: Beautiful square great Christmas markets
text: This is a very busy square with extensive Christmas markets . The clock on the Tower means that lots of people stand in the. Square to listen to the bells and watch the figures go round. There are beautiful buildings all around the square and shops with seasonal displays.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Great location
text: Has everything to offer - food, drink, shopping and history.  If you go in Nov and Dec it has a fab Xmas market

title: magic place
text: It is simply a magic place (that it is always packed!). However, the building is really impressive and at 12.00 it is possible to see and listen to the music from the carillon.

title: Molto bella
text: La piazza √® molto grande e contornata da edifici piu o meno storici. Come il vecchio ed il nuovo municipio con il Carillon pi√π grande della Germania, la chiesa di San  Pietro e negozi e ristoranti.Se andate, come me, a dicembre √® molto caotica per i mercatini di Natale

title: Imperdible
text: El centro de Munich, es un imperdible de la ciudad y esta 100% recomendado, en este lugar se encuentran varios de los free tour.

title: Day visit from Salzburg - Christmas Market
text: Came on the train from Salzburg, then took the S Bann straight to Marienplatz. Very busy Christmas market in a great setting - lots of stalls - unfortunately no snow which always makes a Christmas market IMHO

title: Go for the Christmas Market
text: The Marienplatz is transformed during late November and December to a wonderful Christmas market, with stands set up to buy handmade Christmas ornaments and gifts, and to sell street food and the special ‚ÄúGluhwein‚Äù or spiced, hot red wine. In the Christmas season the Gluhwein is a ‚Äúmust do‚Äù activity - on a cold evening buy a little ceramic cup of the hot liquid (8 Euro - but you get 4 back when you return the cup). It‚Äôs not as extensive as the larger Christmas markets in, for example, Nuremberg, but it is also not as crowded and you get a little bit of everything here!

title: Purely commercial.
text: I don‚Äôt know what we were expected but hoped to be imbued with the Christmas spirit. But sadly we found it generally lacking. There were numerous stalls generally selling over-priced decorations, sausages and mulled wine. Despite the huge crowds, there was a total lack of Christmas music or charity. Even our small local mall manages to give you the Salvation Army brass band playing carols. Where were the choirs or German oompah bands in Munich? I‚Äôm afraid the Marienplatzn was very much a purely commercial experience.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: bella piazza
text: la piazza non √® molto grande ma la bella architettura del municipio la valorizza, io sono stato l√¨ per l'Immacolata e quindi la piazza era piena delle bacarelle del Mercatino di Natale

title: Marienplatz Christmas Market
text: Spent time here on all 4 days in Munich. Wonderful buildings surround the Christmas market which is superb. So many stalls to view or sample the wares of. Great atmosphere especially at night. Would recommend a visit during the market season.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: We stayed to see the Christmas market!? - what a mistake
text: We had a business trip to Munich in early December.  Since we had never visited as a couple, or during December, we made the choice to stay to visit the Christmas markets.  While Munich was wonderful, the markets were a complete waste of time.  Maybe I had the wrong expectation, but I was expecting a cute market with lots of lovely local foods and local craft stalls.  Man, was I wrong!It was all cheap stuff or pre-packaged goods you might finds anywhere.  What a waste of our time!  We really enjoyed walking around the neighborhoods of Munich, and we encourage everyone to enjoy that trip.  But, for Marienplatz and the Christmas markets - don't waste your time.

title: Beautiful Town Square
text: The architectural details of the immense New Town Hall make "Mary's Square" so beautiful.  Everyone who visits Munich gathers here to people watch or grab a bite to eat in one of the many outside seating cafes.  You can feel the exciting pulse of the city as you stand in the middle of the square and take in the 360 degree views.

title: Too crowded Christmas Market
text: I have visited Marienplatz multiple times and its always overcrowded.  The 2019 Christmas Market is no exception.  We spent our time trying to wormhole our way through crowds, baby strollers, and more crowds and more baby strollers.  We could barely see the booths because of the people standing in front of them, not moving, not buying, just standing there.  I keep hearing about how Christmas markets are ‚Äúmagical‚Äù.  Well, not this one, unless your idea of magical is playing a game of frogger through thousands of people.  I have since found some magical Christmas markets, much smaller in scale, in Germany, but I‚Äôm not telling, because then they won‚Äôt be magical anymore.

text: There were so many people and very crowded - but no problems at all.M√ºnich is a wonderful friendly and safe city. ‚ÄúGet you guide‚Äù - Matt - originally from Canada but now in passionate love with M√ºnich - took us on a fantastic almost 3 hours walking tour in the city. title: A walking visit
text: Marienplatz is amazing place to visit its a Marvellous Beautiful City Centre  and its the worth the visit will not be disappointed its the best part of Munich so many shops to look at and see  they rebuilt after WWII of the way going back to how things were

title: A very beautiful square!
text: Numerous buildings with ancient  stories inside them. There were a lot of people in the weekend and,especially, there were a lot of people in the numerous shops.

title: Beautiful Christmas Market
text: Had the wonderful opportunity to visit this week. Christmas Markets were abound in various areas of town. The sights, smells, and beautiful displays were amazing. Fun to walk around the markets sampling gingerbread, hot wine and tasty treats. Craftsmanship excellent. Perfect way to spend a few hours enjoying Christmas fun in Germany.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Worth a visit
text: Marienplatz is the main plaza in the old part of the city center. It is a pedestrian-only area. There are beautiful old historic buildings on and nearby this plaza, along with very many shops and restaurants. It was beautiful both in the day and at night. We were not able to see the Ratskeller glockenspiel in action (only 11:00 am and noon at this time of year) and just missed the Christmas Market by one day. Nearby parking is limited and streets are difficult to navigate, so it is best enjoyed if you are able to walk some distance.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Very beautiful city centre
text: Marienplatz is one of the most beautiful part of Munich, a nice place to wander and do some shopping. Some of the oldest churches in the city are nearby. A must visit once you are in Munich

title: Beautiful area
text: Gotta go here to the center of Munich.  They rebuilt after WWII with the mindset of going back to how things were.

title: Tutto bello tanto caos!
text: Sono stato con la mia famiglia in visita ai mercatini di Natale,piazza molto bella,municipio maestoso ma abbiamo trovato una marea di gente.Difficile persino camminare,file interminabili pre mangiare qualcosa,anche la galleria Kaukof piena all'inverosimile....da ritornaci in periodi piu' tranquilli,ma merita.

title: Christmas market
text: Wow folks a must do if you travel to Europe. So many things to do and food to eat. The gluwine is excellent but if you want a deal on sausages just go to some of the regular shops and buy the same sausage for about $1 or $2 cheaper. The gluwine has to be bought in the market though. Try the cherry wine with rum.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Great Christmas Market
text: Great fun. Lots to see and eat. One of the best Christmas Markets we been to. Love the historic buildings interspersed among the stalls
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: City centre
text: It is a typical German square, surrounded by very beautiful buildings on its sides.I hardly recommend to visit it when there is the Christmas market, as it makes the visit much more interesting. Not to miss it.

title: Christmas Market!
text: Visited the Christmas Market in this beautiful location. Absolutely gorgeous right in the center of the city under the town hall with the giant Christmas tree, so many sights, sounds, and smells. Many nice ornaments to buy. Look out for the ones in the Erzgebirge- they are the real deal. Don‚Äôt buy cheap as many are made in China! The Gl√ºhwein is delicious, the gebrannten Mandeln (roasted sugar coated almonds), potato pancakes (oh my!), Bratwurst in a roll..... I could go on and on. At approximately 5:30pm live musicians perform Christmas music on one of the higher floors of the Rathaus for all in the square below to see and hear.

title: Upscale shopping.  Christmas decorating beginning.

title: Un lugar muy emblematico.
text: Es imposible  irse de Munich y no conocer un lugar tan maravilloso con el ayuntamiento nuevo y el viejo en la misma plaza y sus paradas de Navidad, encantador.

title: Amazing history and architecture.

title: La piazza di Maria.
text: Bellissima piazza che agli inizi del 1300 per volont√† di Ludovico il Bavaro ricevette il Diritto di Mercato, ospitando in questo modo i maggiori eventi pubblici infatti si chiamava piazza mercato. Agli inizi del 1800 a causa di una grande epidemia di colera i cittadini pregarono la Vergine Maria affinch√© terminasse tale flagello, fu cos√¨ che venne dato il nome di Marienplatz. Le attrazioni pi√π belle sono certamente l‚ÄôAltes Rathaus, il vecchio municipio, poi la colonna di  Maria e la Fischbrunner, la fontana del pesce e infine lo spettacolare nuovo municipio col il Glockenspiel il grande carillon. Noi abbiamo visitato gli affollati mercatini di Natale tutti addobbati e pronti a offrire i loro prodotti culinari e artistici molto belli.

title: Christmas market
text: Went there for a bit of shopping and the currently running Christmas market but it was packed and then it w drizzling on and off so finally left earlier than expected as it just got too much not being able to take more than 3 steps without almost bumping into someone. Very frustrating. Usually it's not that bad during the week but weekends it becomes a place to avoid in my book.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Relax, grab a beer
text: Several beer halls around here, you must plan to see the glockenspiel play.  If you come during one of the holidays, you may even see a parade.

title: } Imponente edificio
text: Probablemente sea el mejor vestigio de lo que fue la historia de la ciudad,la mayor√≠a de su patrimonio fue destruido durante la segunda guerra mundial, un edificio muy ornamentado de una bella arquitectura pero con comercios en su primera planta que contribuyen a desmerecerlo, actualmente alberga el ayuntamiento de la ciudad.

title: Excellent place to start your Munich expierience
text: Soak it in. this is the center of old town Munich. While it has been rebuilt, you'll never know what was original and what was rebuilt as they preserved the architectual style.

title: Ambientazo navide√±o europeo
text: Plaza c√©ntrica con el antiguo ayuntamiento y nuevo ayuntamiento con un mont√≥n de puestos navide√±os y mucho ambiente desde la ma√±ana.merece la pena visitarla porque es representativa respecto a los mercados europeos

title: Christmas Market 2010
text: This review is based on the Christmas Market Marienplatz as opposed the the place alone.The main square offers a huge array of stalls with crafts and other festive items to buy. But I'd say about 75% of the stalls are food and drink. They operate a fun method if getting gl√ºhwein, with each stall offering a different style of drink container, from a simple cup with a winter marienplatz scene on it, to a ceramic boot! All the stalls will top up any drinking vessel. You can return your cup for your refund back or keep the item for a souvenir. The square itself offers a great background with all of its historic buildings and the giant Christmas tree looks as festive as you can get at night.Its quieter during the day so if you want an easier life looking round, go during the day for shopping, and then head back at night to simply soak it (and gl√ºhwein) up! Be sure to visit the near by medieval market too as this offers extra activities, drinking vessels and foods not found in the square!

title: Private trip with my son. "Post- October Fest.".
text: Very nice, clean, quiet family-type hotel. The"Family" adjective is really proper in this case. Excellent!

title: Overrated tourist location
text: Even though there are some interesting iconic historical buildings but overall it is a little too crowded and there are just endless shops. We did not have the opportunity to see the Christmas market which I understand is a wonderful experience. I would recommend the Rischart Restaurant which has an extensive menu and good food.

title: Family trip
text: We arrived on the first day of the christmaskindlmarket and the screne is magical! There are so many beautiful shops and opportunities to have authentic German food.

title: Vacanza
text: Piazza meravigliosa, con tantissimi negozi, peccato che le casette di Natale erano ancora chiuse.Molto caratteristico anche il mercatino alimentare vicinissimo alla piazza.

title: Munich Marienplatz
text: M√∫nich es la capital, la mayor y la m√°s importante ciudad del estado federado de Baviera y, despu√©s de Berl√≠n y Hamburgo, la tercera ciudad de Alemania por n√∫mero de habitantes. Se encuentra sobre el r√≠o Isar, al norte de los Alpes B√°varos. El lema de la ciudad es M√ºnchen mag Dich.

title: Beautiful square, beautiful architecture
text: The square is overlooking the new as well as the old town hall. It is a free attraction. If you go at 11AM, you will be able to see the clock playing a story.

title: Visita Monaco di Baviera
text: Visuale di Marienplatz dal campanile della chiesa di Peterskirche, ovvero la chiesa di San Pietro. Per salire su bisogna fare parecchi scalini in posti alquanto angusti, ma per lo splendido panorama di cui si gode dopo ne vale davvero la pena. La consiglio assolutamente!

title: Una piazza accogliente
text: Bella piazza al centro di Monaco. Da non perdere il carrilon sulla torre de comune nuovo che suona con le figure che si muovono. Orari: 11 e 12 nei mesi invernali.

title: Christmas is on the way
text: We were a few days early, only to see vendor setting up their stalls and not open yet. But the fun of Christmas is just in the air. Nice!

title: Just a Square
text: A square with Europe style buildings. Had a market nearby to walk around. A place where you can truly experience local people lifestyle.

title: Quintessential Munich sightseeing
text: Marienplatz is to Munich as the Eiffel Tower is to Paris. It‚Äôs a mandatory stop on any sight seeing tour of Munich. We usually start here as it the easiest and best place to get off the S-Bahn. Of course, if you want to be the typical tourist you can plan to be there when the glockenspiel puts on the show. We avoid the crowd and arrive after this. In every direction are things to see. Do not be afraid to just wander and find things. Wear comfortable shoes since it is easy to walk miles and still not see everything.

title: Devote some time here and enjoy
text: The area is alive with lots of people, sidewalk cafes and shops. Great place to people watch as it is a true melting pot of visitors from all over the planet. We spent an hour here on a couple of occasions during our four day visit. It was during Oktoberfest so we saw lots of happy people coming and going,

title: Christmas visit
text: Nice place to visit during the Christmas build up, lots of stalls setting up. Plenty of mulled wine on sale and lots of shops open until late. The church on Marienplatz is open during the day for a wander through in peaceful silence.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Medieval place
text: Marienplatz is what draws us to visit Munich . One just have to close his eyes and imagine how life was during medieval times. During our short stay, we came there several times for either shopping or wandering around.

title: Must go attraction in Munich
text: Can‚Äôt imagine how to build it! It‚Äôs really incredible! Munich is really good at maintaining historical building!

title: Loved watching the Glockenspiel and wandering around the local markets
text: We enjoyed wandering around the area. The Christmas markets were being set up so was busy with construction. We made sure we were there for 11am for the Glockenspiel. It only operates at 11am and  12pm in winter. There where a lot of little children watching and it was wonderful to see the wonder in their faces. We explored the local food markets. Really good choice of local produce. Every shop you can imagine is also close by

title: Definitely the heart of Munich

Easy to find, easy to get to and easy to meet people at, this is a lovely stop (many times) for your Munich visit!

title: A Happening Place
text: Everything in Old Town M√ºnchen somehow gravitates here.  Historic, iconic, a happening place, the heart of the city, a great hang-out place for eats, shops, even just to watch the world go by.  Like most visitors, we waited on a very nippy day for the spectacle of the noonday revolving figurines:  The Glockenspiel in the tower balcony of the Neues Rathaus or the New Town Hall, resplendently neo-Gothic.  On September 19, we witnessed the locals loudly singing and cheering for Bayern Munich and the pro-Serbian fans singing and cheering Crvena Zvezda, with Munich police in full-battle regalia to make sure all kept calm & peaceful.  Bayern won the UEFA championship then!  Electric atmosphere!  Another day, we had a sumptuous meal @the Ratskeller M√ºnchen restaurant sampling great German fare in very well-appointed surroundings.  We also enjoyed the many shops in and around the Marienplatz!  We loved every minute we were @Marienplatz during our stay.

text: Gruppen √ºber Gruppen verstellen den eigentlich grossen Platz, der immer noch unter Bauarbeiten leidet. title: Il salotto pulsante di Monaco di Baviera
text: Cosa dire di Marienplatz a Monaco di Baviera? Non ci sono parole per descriverla, bisogna  proprio vederla e ammirarla. Si rimane estasiati. Qui i turisti sono migliaia al giorno e convergono da tutta la citt√†. La piazza √® dominata da due imponenti edifici, il Neue Rathaus (nuovo municipio) del 1867-1908 con torre alta 81 mt con inserito il celebre Glockenspiel (il pi√π grande carillon della Germania) con 2 ordini di figuranti (in alto per il matrimonio di Guglielmo V e Renata di Lorena del 1568 in basso per la fine della peste del 1515) e l'Alte Rathaus (vecchio municipio) in stile neo-gotico. del 1400. A centro piazza colonna con in cima la Madonna in bronzo dorato patrona della Baviera. Ai lati negozi, pariccerie ed altro. Ovviamente qui √® tutta isola pedonale. Afondo piazza a destra ci si immette nel grosso mercato cittadino che √® aperto fino a sera.

text: Love this square (platz). The glockenspiel is captivating....make sure you are there at 11 am, noon or 5 pm to witness the show. Walk into the courtyard and see the gargoyles up close. The old rathaus (townhall) is also in the square....having been rebuilt after being razed by WW2 bombing, it appears newer than the 150 yr old new rathaus which was built in the neogothic style (contains the glockendpiel)

title: Nice square
text: It‚Äôs a nice square to be and visit once with mix of old and some refurbished structures. Nice old buildings, churches lots of shops in this area, cafe‚Äôs. Beautiful place to be to know history related in Munich, in short not be missed out there is also beer gardens near by.

title: Mix of old and new
text: Marian Platzl  in the old town of Munich , a very busy and diverse part of the city combining the modern with the old The Rathskeller is a masterpiece of 18 century architecture with tall spires and amazing clock  which has a classic clarion with dancers etc . There is also a darker side to the platz. There is a plaque on the wall of the old Rathskeller which makes mention of Kristalnacht,  My German isn,t great but I think it states that Kristal nacht started in the plaz.  The plaz has many street entertainers and no shortage of restaurant to suit all taste. This is a not to miss area.

title: M√ºnchen
text: Very nice place in germany  and People gather here for events in the city center and shopping centerThis building is considered to be the province or municipality of Munich

title: Worth a visit
text: The Marienplatz is worth visiting especially the New Town Hall which contains the Glockenspiel which is great entertainment on the hour.Great views can be obtain via two lifts inside this building.Marienplatz is easily accessed via the underground railway or Hop on Hop off bus.

title: Like the Grand Place in Brussels only crazier
text: Marienplatz is on every tourist's must-see list I'm sure because it seems like they were all there.  Including us, of course!  The square is beautiful for sure with its ancient buildings and that famed clock it's just picturesque for sure.And to make it more appealing there are tons of restaurants and shops from small, independent ones to a mall...  My favorite store, Ludwig Beck, has its main Munich branch there so how convenient is that?!  Also across from Ludwig Beck is another favorite:  Hugendubel. bookshop.  Between Ludwig Beck & Hugendubel I am heaven.  Anyway, I'd recommend not eating on the plaza itself as it's tourist central.  Go a short stroll on the sides or in back as there are more restaurants not so touristy.  And there is also a local market selling all sorts of fruits and vegetables as well as flowers and cheeses, nuts, meats a few steps away from the square.  Worth a walk to see what's still a part of an authentic tradition.

title: Vacation
text: Great all around... don't miss out on the beer garden...the beer garden  is a must  across  from beluga chocolate  store...
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Amazing show
text: We stumbled accidentally by exiting the subway and watched a beautiful show of the clock. Definitely recommend coming here early and getting a good spot to get your camera ready for a breathtaking, detailed, amazing show.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Centre of the town
text: This platz is popular with the tourist because of the chimming clock tower.Go when it chimes and watch the various characters rotate.Plenty of tourist around so beware. Pickpockets have been reported around!

title: Marienplatz is a must-see!
text: Once you‚Äôre in the historic downtown Munich area, one thing you have to do is watch the glockenspiel at 5 PM!  (there are other times but I haven‚Äôt watched it then!) You will hear the clock chime and watch the figurines come out.....This is very historical and very charming! So plan on meeting your friends here at five and then going to dinner from there!

title: Explore Shopping and Biergartens
text: The first day in Munich, we went walking down Marienplatz and there was so much to see. The architecture alone was gorgeous, and there are so many stores, restaurants, and biergartens to explore. If you go far enough, you turn left and arrive at the Hofbrau Haus, which was wonderful in itself. This was a great experience.

title: Beautiful Area
text: Must visit when in Munich.  Beautiful buildings, always love to watch the clock, too.  Architecture is just beautiful and a fun place to visit.  Crowded for sure, people just hangout.  On Sunday it was extremely busy and nothing is even open except for restaurants in the area.  It is always nice to see "Sunday" being a day for family.  Used to have that in the USA when I grew up, not anymore.  Pretty sad when you think about it.  Nice to be in Europe and see how different somethings are.  I recommend this area when in Munich.

title: Very Busy Historical Square
text: Naturally during Oktoberfest, one of the most sought after and historical sights in Munich would be very crowded!  Marienplatz is a beautiful square flanked by the Gothic spectacular Neues Rathaus housing the famous Glockenspiel. Like everyone else, we wanted to see it chime - everyday at 11:00, 12:00 and 5:00pm (not at 5pm during the winter months). Luckily, there's plenty of room for everyone to stand and view the tower and, if you're willing to film it for 12-15 mins, you can watch the chiming again at home!  Pop into the Rischart cafe beforehand and buy yourself a delicious Bavarian almond pretzel while you watch the entertaining spectacle!

title: Old city area with lovely architecture
text: Most certainly a must do for those coming to Munich for tourism. Enjoyable during the day for the attractions but just as enjoyable lit up in the evening with less crowds.

title: History

text: We had an awesome view of the Glockenspiel in Munich. Although it was raining, we were able to sit at an outdoor cafe, and watch and listen to the lovely Glockenspiel music while the various figurines moved to the music.

text: Pronounced ‚ÄúMarie-en-platz‚Äù and not ‚ÄúMarian-platz,‚Äù this is a must see if you are in Munich.  The new town hall (which looks very old and Gothic) is a beautiful building. title: Ein Muss in M√ºnchen
text: Wenn man M√ºnchen besucht, dann kommt am Marienplatz nicht vorbei. Warum? Hier gibt gleich mehrere Sehensw√ºrdigkeiten zu bewundern: Neues Rathaus (Marienplatz 8), Altes Rathaus (Marienplatz 15), Rathausturm (Marienplatz 15), Rischarts Backhaus (Marienplatz 18), Marienplatz 21, (einziges erhaltenes Haus aus der Vorkriegsbebauung des, Marienplatzes), Mariens√§ule, Fischbrunnen, und, und, und...Das Glockenspiel mit 43 Glocken, deren Anschlag nach Jahreszeit wechselnd von sechs verschiedenen Walzen ausgel√∂st wird, ert√∂nt t√§glich um 11 und 12 Uhr sowie von M√§rz bis Oktober um 17 Uhr.Die zahlreichen Cafes und Restaurants laden zum Verweilen und zum Konsumieren. title: Great for watching hordes of other tourist
text: The primary attraction is to watch the Glockenspiel on New Town Hall at 11am, noon and 5pm. Otherwise, this is the primary hub for tour operators to gather their flocks for setting out around the city. If your timing is good and you can score a table at one of the cafes fronting the square, you can while away a couple of hours watching the sea of tourists ebb and flow.

title: Lindo
text: Vale la pena la visita, plaza emblem√°tica, lo recomiendo ampliamente, es de los lugares obligados si visitas la ciudad

title: Go at Midday (12pm) to see the clock show
text: The architecture of the Rathaus at Marienplatz is absolutely amazing. There are a lot of tourists there but rightly so.There is a clock show everyday at midday and it is such a unique experience. The adult life-size figures in the clock tell a story while you watch it and it's like nothing I've seen anywhere else in Europe.The show lasts about 10-15 minutes. There is also restaurants surrounding Marienplatz so you can also get food while watching the clock show.

text: Heel mooi plein met prachtige gebouwen en goeie vibe. Absolute must in M√ºnchen. Het klokkenspel om 12 uur met de bewegende beelden is erg leuk. Doet aan Praag denken.

title: Sightseeing in Munique.
text: On our trip in Germany we were also on the ‚ÄúMarienplatz‚Äù or ‚ÄúMaria's Square‚Äù, this is the  square in central Munich, who has been founded in  the year 1158. In the center of the square is the Column of Mary erected in the year 1638, which gives its name to the square. In the square is Neues Rathaus, the new neo-Gothic town hall with a famous clock and carillon. Also different restaiurants and caf√©es. Nice location but you have to inform you about the correct time to see and hear the carillon working.

title: Tourist centre of Munich
text: The biggest square in Munich contains a host of tourist attractions, dominated by the enormous gothic Rathaus, with its famous Glockenspiel. There are two fountains, the Mariensaule topped by its golden statue of the Virgin Mary and the Fishbrunnen with its huge carp. The square also has the toy museum (Spielzeug) on one side and is surrounded by shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, of which the best is the huge traditional Bavarian eatery, the Ratskeller under the Rathaus. A magical place, but a very crowded one and also an absolute paradise for thieves and pick pockets, so be careful.

title: Crowded!!

title: Historical, Interesting and Central.
text: I happened to select a hotel within walking distance to Marienplatz.....and how lucky was I! It's an easy metro ride after getting off the airport train and central to many of Munich's iconic locations. The pedestrian mall is a great spot to sit to relax and people watch. There are countless restaurants and shops close by and places of historical importance are within walking distance too.

title: An old town with new looks
text: After the bombing in third world war most of the buildings have come up as small replicas or new ones. But the square retains its old world charm and its history. The town halls are a beauty to see.Not to be missed

text: Well, you just need to be there during a rounded hour in order to see the clock playing together with dolls!

title: A must visit attraction
text: We have been to Munich three times now (once just passing through and twice for extended stays).  All three times we have walked over to Marienplatz to check out the nearby markets, churches and the glockenspiel that's a part of the exterior of the City Hall.  If you understand any of the local history, the chiming of the glockenspiel and the movement of its characters tell a uniquely local story.  It's interesting to watch all of the tourists and tour members taking videos and pictures of the glockenspiel in action.  Having seen it three times now, I must admit to being somewhat underwhelmed by it all, but when in Marienplatz....!  There are other attractions nearby- shops, a farmers market, restaurants and churches (including one with a bejeweled skeleton enclosed in a glass coffin).    When in Munich - this is a place to visit.

title: Beautiful Marienplatz in Munich, Altstadt!
text: This is one of the most beautiful plazas in Europe.  The buildings are structurally amazing.  The clocks with musical and dancing toys come to life three times a day and it is fun to watch.  The whole area is always so crowded with tourists taking photos of the buildings and clocks and waiting for the few minutes clock show.  There is also a food market very close to the plaza with lots of great food and beer places.  We spent hours walking in Marienplatz area, Kreuzviertel, Theatine Church of St. Cajetan, and Court Garden and other areas of old town Munich.  It is a charming city with good food and good beer.  Our dinner, pretzel, and beers at Hofbrauhaus Brewery with an amazing Bavarian atmosphere were fantastic.  Visit the place when you are in Munich.

title: A wonderful place
text: I came to Munich for the Oktoberfest! Marienplatz is in the middle of the altstadt, the old city. The Germans rebuilt this city according to what it used to be. Many buildings have lots of history in them if you want to do a little digging.  But you also can just appreciate the beauty of them, along with good food and beer! Prost!

title: Lots of Activity
text: This was a national holiday, so lots of people about. Felt safe, enjoyed street musicians, sidewalk artist, and cooked chesnut  kiosk.

title: Absolutely Beautiful
text: One of the most beautiful gothic style buildings I have ever seen in my life! The detail is unreal! Beautiful area to shop in. Many shops of food, sweets, coffee, shoewear, clothing, souvenir shops etc.available. Would definitely recommend to shop and eat here, as well as sighting seeing all in one!

title: Center of Munich
text: Marienplatz is the center of it all! Very nice square. Great to see the Glockenspiel. Fun hub of the city.

title: A must see experience
text: This square is bustling with tourist, entertainment, and everyday working people. There are many shops and restaurants here as well. The energy is very vibrant.

title: Fabulous atmosphere!
text: Lovely time spent here during the day and night.  Lots of street entertainers to see while you enjoy lunch or a beer at one of the outside restaurants.  Plenty of places, museums to visit.  Go see the Glockenspiel Clock at 11am, 12pm or 5pm to watch the statues move or go right to the top for a view of the city.

title: Nice but not must-see
text: We were requested to meet at Marienplatz to gather for a city bike tour (excellent Mikes Bike Tour). Marienplatz is an easy to find and central location for our first trip to Munich.  The square is large and surrounded by standard shops cafes etc.  The central focus of the square is the large glockenspiel that draws hundreds of visitors for the show.  It is impressive and worth seeing if you are in the area.  I wouldn‚Äôt lose sleep if we didn‚Äôt see it though.  Good place to meet up with people or to shop or eat.

title: Remarkable Architecture in Munich
text: One of the classic Munich sights with remarkable architecture, pretty hanging flowers, and the Glockenspiel tower. Worth a drive by sightseeing, but otherwise not much to do.

title: The heart of Munich
text: The Marienplatz is a great place for tourism in Munich. Nice place to buy souvenirs and  to spend the day with other tourists. The tours office is located here as well.

title: A beautiful place
text: A lovely place full of historical architecture, shops and restaurant. I love to visit it early in the morning, afternoon and before sunset. You will find many musicians and activity during the day. A must visit while you are in Munich.

title: Beautiful
text: If you are planning a trip to Munich, late September is the best time to go.  Oktoberfest in bloom, the weather is temperate and cool.  The people and spirit intoxicating!In the middle of it all is Marienplatz.  The setting for the Rathaus and amazing clock tower.  Every hour people stop, stare and listen to the chimes and action of the tower.  A sea of cell phones rise up to capture in video the experience!

title: A little shopping
text: Marienplatz was in walking distance from our hotel, The Charles.We strolled down the historic streets on the morning we were leaving to go home and it was a delightful way to spend our last morning in Munich.

title: Marienplatz is a must see for anyone coming to Munich
text: Marienplatz is a great place to visit. It is full of beautiful architecture and history. Walk around and see the sights with a tour or solo.

title: Centre historique de Munich
text: Place incontournable de Munich. Entour√©e de b√¢tisses magnifiques. C‚Äôest le centre historique de la ville. Nombreux commerces et activit√©s autour de ce lieu.

title: Great square
text: In Munich visiting various outdoor markets and the town square. Beside the town square is the town hall as well. Make sure you go up the elevator in the clock tower to get a great view of the square and surrounding area.

title: Be there at noon
text: The concert bells are played at noon. Actually a couple of minutes past 12. It lasts for about 10 minutes. It‚Äôs very well done and easy to see and hear all over the square even though a lot of people will be there. Many restaurants in the square. They are a bit expensive so if you want to save some euros you can easily find other nice places in the neighbourhood.

title: Great starting point to see Munich
text: Marienplatz is absolutely gorgeous! Try to go at 11 am or 5 pm when the giant clock of the Rathaus will be playing (moving figures and music). Marienplatz is a great central area of Munich, within easy walking distance of multiple churches, the Viktualienmarkt, Hofbrauhaus, cute shops, a toy museum, etc! You can easily spend a day or two in this area of Munich alone.

title: The place in Munich
text: You can‚Äôt help finding it and it‚Äôs a must see for the Glockenspiel show. But also take a look around the square and the immediately surroundings. So much to see here and I only a few blocks.

title: Most popular
text: Marienplatz is the central square in Munich enclosed by New Townhall and Old Townhall and attracts visitors in hordes. It has many popular restaurants. Frauenkirche and Hofbrauhaus are close by.

title: Spend some time here
text: Restaurants, shops and history. A must do while in Munich. It is the town center. Spend a few hours here and have lunch or dinner.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A PLETHORA OF THINGS TO SEE!
text: Sitting and having a quite brunch, lunch or afternoon tea is the way to drink in all that is around you by visiting the Marienplatz.  So much to see and do in this lively area.  The Glockenspiel is the main attraction inside the "old town" and according to some, it is a "must see".  Would have been an absolute marvel during its time, however the waiting for this old world "wonder" seems forever and while it holds character, there are other more attractive things to explore. Many tourists gather around to watch and take pictures of its workings.  From memory the clock performs twice a day - once at 11am and the other (I think) at 2 or 3pm. There are plenty of shops for those who are into retail therapy, lots of cosy and quirky little cafes and many side streets that also hold a wonder of different attractions.  The Old Town is definitely a "must do" when visiting Munich.  So much history and architecturally beautiful buildings.  A good way to spend a day or at least a full morning or afternoon, depending on your itinerary.

title: Nicr
text: So we really enjoyed seeing this building st night.  The lights, the details. All very nice and if you‚Äôre lucky to see the music and characters come out wow worth the timed visit.

title: Lively place to enjoy a drink
text: Marienplatz is constantly busy with tourists and locals, and will be particularly packed at 11am and 5pm for the Glockenspiel. It's worth braving the crowds to watch the entertaining display. Grab a coffee or snack at any of the cafes surrounding the square while you wait.

title: A must see!
text: The Marien Platz is the center of the 'old Munich' and is a pure delight to see - the underground trains have this as a goal from all over Munich and some streets are off limits for cars giving a sense of a wide open mall.  The plaza is named after the mother of Jesus, Mary, and a golden statue hovers about the very large open square.  Shops and stores and restaurants abound - the famous Hofbrauhaus is an easy walk  10 minutes away.  I enjoy the Rathaus restaurant which is down a long stairway to an underground place for a snack but for sure a delightful lunch or dinner.

title: Beautiful setting
text: Beautiful setting with the obligatory tourist price gouging. The clock movement on the hour is famous worldwide.

title: The more we visited, the more we enjoyed!
text: We've read many reviews where folks suggest you can do Munich in a couple days - for us, we spent two weeks and found ourselves back to the Marienplatz area 6 or 7 times.  Each time we explored another direction off center.  Lots of great food, great drink, and the people watching is entertaining in itself.   Take the time to experience, not just pass through.   We had numerous meals / drinks here, watched the Marienplatz show several times.

title: Great place to visit
text: We toured the main spots of Munich, which included Marienplatz. As we toured ourselves, we didn't know a lot about Marienplatz and were delighted to be just in time for the Rauthaus-Glockenspiel show.There were quite a few other tourists there to watch the show as well, with plenty of room for everyone to see. We later found out the show is offered 3 times a day in the summer and lasts around 15 minutes. If you are in the area, check it out as it is something to experience.The rest of Marienplatz square contained shops, restaurants and street performers. There is also an option to pay a fee to go into Marienplatzand climb the towers however we did not opt to do that on this trip.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: It's a great place if you are culturally or somehow connected to here
text: It's a nice place to "reconnect" with your culture, provided you are of the "right" culture. People are quite aggressive here, not very respectful. If you are not of the "right" person, you can dress well, be very pleasant, spend money and still be treated poorly.  I was denied service in several places on the Marienplatz.  It's a place for people who are from there, or of the "right" type, then you will enjoy it.  If you are not of the "right" you know what, you won't be treated well.  At most they well tolerate you.  All that friendly stuff is pretty phony otherwise.  Yes, if your ancestors came from here, it's great.  You will enjoy it.

title: Wonderful place to visit
text: This is a fun place to visit, even in the rain.  There are lots of shops, churches, and restaurants in the area.

title: Visita obligada
text: Marienplatz es lo m√°s conocido y reconocible de la ciudad.El reloj/carrillon se puede ver a las 11/12 y 17 hs (en verano) es algo que no debes perderte, pero la plaza requiere una segunda visita sin tanta gente para poder contemplarla bien.Los alrededores de la plaza son para perderse, comer en alg√∫n Haus...y visitar el mercado Viktualienmarkt (donde puedes comer y beber).Entra en edificio del ayuntamiento y sube a la torre para ver las magn√≠ficas vistas

title: Busy , atmospheric stop
text: Great spot to get a feel of Munich, busy with tourists all there for the 5pm chimes. Fabulous building as centerpiece, great photo opp. Wouldn't spend more thank 10 mins here, but leads to the shopping areas and churches

title: Glockenspiel, churches, and people watching
text: The glockenspiel is overrated to the locals, but worth the time to see. There are 4 churches fanning out within a few blocks of the town halls that are all worth a visit.

title: tourist trap
text: Op zich aardig om het poppenspel op de kerktoren te zien, verder is het vooral de plaats waar je niet moet zijn om wat te eten of te drinken.

title: Aantrekkelijk
text: Daar zijn een paar plaatsen waarop je kan van bovenop naar Marienpltz te kijken. Eerste is Pieterskerk. En tweede nieuwe Rathause.

title: Bustling square
text: This is a beautiful, bustling square in the heart of Munich. The architecture is nice to look at. There are some great streets just off this square, including one with a beautiful old food store that reminded me of Fortnum and Mason in London.

title: Focal point
text: Yes it is the central square in beautiful Munich and is surrounded by new gothic municipal buildings (the new town hall) and older equivalents (the old town hall). It‚Äôs scenic enough but for me is more an aid to navigation than a worthy destination in its own right.

title: Picture Pretty
text: Beautiful square with incredible architecture and outdoor cafes.. Sit, enjoy a glass of wine or cup of cappuccino, a bite to eat and soak in the beauty. A must see in Munich.. text: Beautiful local market where both tourists and locals can enjoy. Variety choice of food and drinks around.

title: Nice entrance to Munich
text: Nice square with old and interesting buildings. The new city hall, that is actually old, is beautiful and has the most interesting clock. You can watch te figurines dancing and playing music three times a day: 11 am, 12 pm and 5 pm. It will probably take 10 minutes to see the whole show. The first 4 minutes is only music, wait after that to starting recording the figurines. There are several cafes and bakeries in the area.

title: The jewel in the crown of Munich
text: Hard to think that you could go to Munich and miss this platz.  It is stunningly beautiful with a really great atmosphere.

title: Beautiful
text: The area is alive with beautiful buildings, churches and music as well as an abundance of restaurants.  Will be back.

title: Superbe tour n√©o-gothique
text: L'ancienne h√¥tel devant la colonne Mariale c√©l√©brant la victoire sur les troupes Su√©doises, garde une odeur de poudre. On peut croiser des joutes violentes au sortir de la guerre de 30 ans, les Su√©dois sont mis en fuite cela nous √©pargnera l"insupportable Greta Thornberg.

title: Watch with hand on your wallet
text: The clock does it's thing at 11 and noon.  There are tons of people mulling around with all their eyes pointed upwards, just be aware of who is next to you!  Had a guy come stand very close to my husband, I looked right at him, but he didn't move, then we moved 3 steps away - and he walked away.  I'm convinced he was going to pickpocket us.   The clock show last about 10 mins.  First the parade by the happy couple and a joust, then the lower have of the dancing men.  The rooster crows at the top at the end and easy to miss.  It's worth a look and fun to hear the crowd react to the show.

title: Munich Christmas Market on Marienplatz
text: It is amazing, you must try this, once in lifetime. You can taste street food with local speciality and to drink hot wine. We spend such lovely days before Christmas, there are a lot of tourists, the city is full o lights and the market full o beautiful accessories for Christmas tree.

title: Great City
text: Mareineplatz for the Glockenspiel, also have a look inside the Church at the Rathaus. What really impressed me on my trip was the Dokumenntation Centre which presents a history of the Nazi Party. It is free and well worth a trip. Munich is a perfect place to spend a weekend.

title: Main Square
text: Main square at the heart of a lively pedestrian zone. This is where the New Town Hall is and the Glckenspiel is. There is lots of shopping and places to eat.

title: Marienplatz
text: The architecture and old world ambience are absolutely amazing.  I could have walked around here for days.

title: Old world charm discovered during a layover
text: I had 11 hour layover at Munich Airport, and I decided to spend it at Marienplatz. It's at the center of the city and only 45 minutes on the train from the Airport. While you are there do not miss the Beer at the viktualienmarkt. Take the streetcar from one end to another to see the city views.

title: Excellent spot to relax.
text: The square has everything you want.  Amazing architecture, excellent restaurants where you can sit outside and enjoy the sights, tons of shopping.

title: HERMOSA
text: Una hermosa plaza rodeada de comercios y restaurantes,en la fachada del edificio principal se encuentra un reloj con figuras que se mueven creando un ambiente de consternacion en los visitantesLuego todos siguen caminando con absoluta tranquilidad y seguridad aunque el lugar esta repleto de personas el ambiente es muy seguroMusicos amenizan el lugar con sus virtuosas habilidades dejando a todos detenidos por placenteros periodos de tiempo donde te transportas a tiempos donde hace mucho tiempo los habitantes de este lugar disfrutaban del clima y la belleza que ofrece la plaza.

title: City Centre
text: The heart of Munich towered by the town hall and the fascination of the glockenspiel! Plenty of restaurants and shops in the vicinity

title: IL FULCRO DI MONACO
text: Bellissima piazza che incanta. Facile da raggiungere con la metro praticamente in piazza. Edifici bellissimi. L'orologio storico √® meraviglioso.

title: Nice European City
text: Very nice to walk around and see the sites. It's quite a typical European city so take that for what it is.

title: Lovely square
text: Love Munich, love Germany! We enjoyed the Beer Garden's atmosphere and the band music. Plus, the Church in the square and fantastic architecture, food in the market was also a bonus!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Fun place to visit, awesome historic buildings
text: Marienplatz is the central square in the city center of Munich, Germany.  It has been the city's main square since 1158, and is within walking distance of the Hauptbahnhof which was near where I was staying.  Visited several times on my trip to Munich. There is so much to see and absolutely recommend just walking around for at least a few hours to absorb the culture, history and beauty. Close to any number of open markets, lots of nice coffee shops, bistros, restaurants and shops., outdoor beer gardens, etc‚Ä¶ Not to miss there is the Glockenspiel.  The architecture is just beautiful.

title: Large shopping area
text: This and all the surrounding area has great shopping and history and culture. This is also where the bike tour started that we took.

title: A Lovely Place to Explore
text: I loved strolling this pedestrian-only plaza.  There are many shops and restaurants to explore, as well as beautiful architecture to admire.

title: Excellent
text: Stunning, great shopping with lots of cafes, markets & surrounded by magnificent architecture. Great place to people watch!

title: Gorgeous plaza

title: Piazza principale di Monaco
text: Marienplatz √® la piazza principale di Monaco di Baviera; zona pedonale con locali per bere e mangiare e nogozi per lo shopping. La piazza √® molto ampia e piena di gente, turisti e non. Si affaccia il Palazzo Municipale con la sua Torre con orologio e carillon con statuine; a seconda della stagione ci sono orari differenti in cui assistere allo spettacolo del carillon: le statuine girano al suono di una melodia. title: Heart of Munich

title: Stunningly Pretty
text: I didn‚Äôt know what to really expect on my trip to Munich but I absolutely loved it!  The architecture is breathtaking and we found numerous pretty squares to enjoy a drink or a bite to eat. The infrastructure is amazingly efficient with trams and a wonderfully efficient train service and the area in general is classy, elegant and beautiful!  Loved it!!!

title: So much to see
text: We visited several times on our short trip to Munich. There is so much to see and absolutely recommend just walking around for at least a few hours to absorb the culture, history and beauty. The Glockenspiel is also one to watch, it plays I think at noon, 1500 and 1700. It's amazing and worth standing amongst the crowds for. The tourist information centre is located right there where you can get maps of the city. The market is just around the corner, as is the famous Hofbrauhaus. The Marienplatz is also walking distance to several S-Bahn stations, so worth walking to a few if you can to see more of this amazing city.

text: Beautiful part of town, spoiled for choice. Plenty of Shops, Restaurants, Bars and its very central, Transportation is very good loads of options to get around the City. Beautiful Buildings and Arches, keep your wits when crossing Roads though, some Drivers dont need the Green Man!

title: Beautiful old buildings
text: Around this square there are a number of beautiful old buildings. While some are repurposed as high end retailers and food places, it is still free to look around. U-bahn and other transport services are close at hand.

title: Fun place to visit
text: The Marienplatz was a fun place to visit. To see the old and new, to hear the glockenspiel, to wander through the shops was all great!  Many tours leave from this area so it is a great starting point to your Munich journey.
